intro: Erigeron fernandezii f. tragopogonoides, commonly known as the Tragopogonoides fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a distinctive purple or brown center. This variety is notable for its ecological role in supporting pollinators and its resilience in arid environments.
